results.title: The Tuna coast
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Fred Clarke
results.brief_description: Filmed against the splendour of the rugged south-east coast of Tasmania, the deep-sea fishing enthusiast meets his match hunting the mighty tuna. Examines the well-established sport of deep-sea fishing showing two anglers on the hunt for tuna and other big game fish.

results.title: The Truth about cats and dogs
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Noon Attack, Cari-Esta Albert, Richard Hashimoto and Michael Lehmann
results.brief_description: When panicked photographer Brian has trouble with a disagreeable Great Dane, he calls Dr Abby Barnes (Janeane Garofalo) a radio veterinarian whose daily program helps people with their problem pets. The pair develop an instant connection over the telephone and the eager Brian invites Abby out, asking for a description of herself so he can find her in a crowd. Lacking in self-confidence, Abby describes her neigbour, best friend and model, Noelle (Uma Thurman). When Abby stands him up, Ben comes to the studio looking for answers, and happens to see Noelle. Abby explains the situation to Noelle, who agrees to take her place, while Abby assumes the character of Donna. While Abby develops a relationship with Brian over the telephone and the radio, Noelle is the woman he believes he is talking to. Things become more complicated when Noelle falls for Brian, and Brian starts to wonder why his new girlfriend seems to have two different personalities.

results.title: The Trumpet of the swan
results.creator_credit: Tiny Tot Productions, Lin Oliver, Richard Rich and Terry L Noss
results.brief_description: Louie, a Trumpeter swan born without a voice, falls in love but has no way of communicating his emotions. Feeling despondent and at odds with his siblings with wonderful calls, he leaves home on a journey where he meets a young boy called Sam and his teacher, Mrs Hammerbotham, who teaches Louie how to speak. Learning English is not the solution to Louie’s problem however as none of the other swans can understand him. A solution is reached when Louie’s father gives his son a trumpet which he begins to play proficiently. Unbeknownst to Louie though, his father has stolen the trumpet in a moment of desperation to help his son. A stint in a jazz band and a race to reclaim his now engaged childhood love, Serena, ensues in this animated adaption of E.B. White’s classic children’s tale. Features the voices of Dee Baker, Jason Alexander, Reese Witherspoon, Seth Green, Carol Burnett, Mary Steenburgen and Joe Mantegna.

results.title: The Truman show
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Scott Rudin, Andrew Niccol, Edward S. Feldman, Adam Schroeder and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Truman Burbank (Jim Carrey) is the star of a television experiment: he does not know that since birth his life has been the centre of a television show called The Truman Show.

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount Pictures, Scott Rudin, Andrew Niccol, Edward S. Feldman, Adam Schroeder and Peter Weir
results.description: Truman Burbank (Jim Carrey) is the star of a television experiment: he does not know that since birth his life has been the centre of a television show called The Truman Show. The world he lives in is one giant TV set and his family, his marriage and his work are all shams. Gradually, however, Truman comes to suspect that there is something not quite right with his life. As Truman attempts to discover the truth behind the banality of his existence, his attempts are frustrated by the control and power of the man (Ed Harris) who has created “his” life; and by the expectations of a TV audience who have themselves grown up on The Truman Show. From this fantastical premise, Peter Weir has created a moving fable about our obsession with media and the destructive potential of such obsession. Truman exists in a world where reality is meaningless but the film posits that the audiences who watch his life unfold on television are themselves blind to the distinction between media and the real. Weir has crafted a morality tale which utilises the best of contemporary studio craft to present a tale with the simple force and grace of a modern fairy tale.

results.title: The Truly exceptional Dan Haley
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company, Dave Bell Associates, James Thompson and John Cosgrove
results.brief_description: A 16 year old who has lost 80% of his vision and will eventually be completely blind, Dan Haley does not think of himself as a handicapped person, and leads an active life. His biggest problem is that people try to do too much for him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Educational Media Company, Dave Bell Associates, James Thompson and John Cosgrove

results.title: The True story of the Civil War
results.creator_credit: Camera Eye Pictures and Louis Clyde Stoumen
results.brief_description: A record of the American Civil War period made up mostly with Mathew Brady’s original wet plate photographs made on the field of battle and contemporary newspaper illustrations (Harper’s Weekly). Relates the story of the war, describing its causes, its battles, its leaders and its effects on the nation. Narrated by Raymond Massey. (Award: Best Documentary, Short Subjects, 1957 Academy Awards)

results.title: The True story of Lili Marlene
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and Humphrey Jennings
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of the British counter-propaganda campaign against the popular German forces program from the Belgrade Radio. The theme song “Lili Marlene” introduced the German “Message from Home” session. The film shows how the Germans came to use the song, how the British captured it and how the BBC turned the song to our advantage during the African Desert campaign. The British Eighth Army adopted “Lili Marlene” as their own special marching song. Appearance by Marius Goring.

results.title: The True story of Eskimo Nell
results.creator_credit: Quest Films, Richard Franklin and Ron Baneth
results.brief_description: Two horny rogues on a road trip are out to find the illustrious lover (aka ‘womper’) from Alaska named Eskimo Nell. Dead Eye Dick (Max Gillies) and Mexico Pete (Serge Lazareff) travel around the Australian goldfields trying to bed women wherever they go. Dead Eye Dick is more talk than action as he has his heart set on finding Nell. Very much the storyteller, Dead Eye’s fanciful tales land the two in trouble and they often have to leave town in a hurry. Boobs and bawdiness abound in this ‘historical’ comedy drama from writers Alan Hopgood and Richard Franklin - also produced and directed by Franklin. Music by Brian May. Cast includes Abigail, Grahame Bond, Kris McQuade, Elli Maclure, Paul Vachon, Anthony Bazell, Ernie Bourne.

results.title: The True glory
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Information, United States. Office of War Information, Carol Reed and Garson Kanin
results.brief_description: A joint British-American documentary account of the allied invasion of Europe during World War II compiled from footage shot by nearly 1400 cameramen. Introduced by General Eisenhower it covers all the major events of the war in Europe from the Normandy landings to the fall of Berlin. Cast includes Dwight D. Eisenhower (as himself), Robert Harris (commentator) and Peter Ustinov (as himself). (Award: Best Documentary, Features 1946 Academy Awards)

results.title: The Trout harvest
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Victoria. Dept. of Fisheries and Wildlife and Ted Davis
results.brief_description: The Snobs Creek fish hatchery was newly established at this time, and this film shows how the fish are bred from the egg stage to liberation into rivers and lakes. This film was included in the San Francisco Film Festival 1961.
